page.title: 01A General View of Hellifield
page.content: {Hellifield}is a rural villlage, straddling the main Skipton-Kendal trunk road,surrounded by low and high grazing farmland. The{population}is about 1000. {Employment}now is generally sought in local towns and villages. Important{meeting places}include St.Aidan's Church, the Methodist Chapel,Workings Men's Club,Village Institute and the Black Horse Hotel. { The Auction Mart,}a focus for nearby farming commumities, holds sales once a week.A bank is open on this day. {The County Primary School,}in the evenings provides a venue for local recreational and educational groups. The village is served by a Post Office,several shops and an agricultural supplier.
